they will be conveyed to the office of the Mayor.
VIOLENT OR SUDDEN DEATH, ACCIDENTS, ETC.
Sec. 19. In case a Police Officer or Policeman
finds a person dead, he will immediately cause information of the event to be communicated to the
Coroner and the relatives or friends of the deceased ; he will prevent unnecessary exposure of
the body, and shall not move it from the place
where it was found, except in case of absolute necessity.
Sec. 20. If he should find a person dying or
seriously injured, he will send immediately for a
physician or convey the person home with all possible care and speed, or if nearest, and in any way
desirable, will convey him to the hospital or to the
Police Station House.
If the person be dying in consequence of injuries or violence, the public officer will make every
exertion to arrest the offenders, and will immediately send for the Recorder of the District or any
